Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label two different habitats, one land habitat (e.g., playground, garden, forest) and one water habitat (e.g., pond, stream, lake).
The student can include and label at least three different types of living things in each habitat (e.g., trees, grasses, fish, lizards).
The student can show differences in living things between the two habitats by including specific plants and animals unique to each habitat.
The student can illustrate patterns showing the diversity of plants and animals across the two habitats.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly display how observations are made and recorded through their illustrations.
